description: {"blocks":[{"key":"3stdr","text":"This protocol helps you determine the minimum inhibitory concentration (MIC) of butanol for E. coli KJK01. However, this technique can be extended to determine the MIC of any metabolite for any strain by making adjustments to the concentration of the metabolite in the starting wells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
keywords: E. coli, Minimum inhibitory concentration, butanol

references.title: Comprehensive characterization of toxicity of fermentative metabolites on microbial growth.

status.info: We use this protocol and itâ€™s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"feve5","text":"Calculate the amount of butanol that you require in the starting well. Wilbanks 2017 paper suggests that butanol shows strong toxic effects below 10 g/L and entirely inhibits growth at 15 g/L. We should expect our MIC to fall in this range. Hence, we can start with an initial concentration of 60 mg/ml. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"hhv7","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2bj17","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"citation","mutability":"","data":{"authors":"Wilbanks B, Trinh CT","can_edit":1,"date":"1512000000","doi":"https://doi.org/10.1186/s13068-017-0952-4","guid":"629F40402DE411ECAB1BD1B46B395B5D","id":1367,"journal":"Biotechnology for biofuels","protocol_id":"0","title":"Comprehensive characterization of toxicity of fermentative metabolites on microbial growth."}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"50vdf","text":"Cover the 96 welled plate with foil and place it in the incubator at 37oC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":71,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fkc7m","text":"Take a reading of the plate using any plate reader every hour and place it back in the incubator. You may run this for 24 hrs.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"62iv3","text":"Obtain a growth curve for each strain and concentration. Identify the least concentration for which the growth curve shows a sharp drop. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
